item.title: Prince Philip's funeral to mark his 'unwavering loyalty'
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh's link to the Navy and love of the sea will be a focus of the Windsor service.

item.title: Prince Philip: Queen shares one of her favourite photos
item.description: Released on the eve of the duke's funeral, it shows the couple relaxing in the Scottish countryside.

item.title: Helen McCrory: Peaky Blinders actress dies aged 52, husband Damian Lewis says
item.description: The star, who has died of cancer, was a "beautiful and mighty woman", her husband Damian Lewis said.

item.title: Raúl Castro steps down as Cuban Communist Party leader
item.description: His resignation ends his family's six-decade hold on power in Cuba.

item.title: Covid: Canada sounds the alarm as cases overtake US
item.description: Infections in the largest province could increase sixfold without tougher measures, experts warn.

item.title: Nasa chooses SpaceX to build Moon lander
item.description: SpaceX will build a lander that the US space agency will use to return humans to the Moon this decade.

item.title: Pregnant women should be offered Covid vaccine
item.description: The UK's vaccine advisers encourage them to discuss the risks and benefits with their doctor.

item.title: Everton 2-2 Tottenham: Harry Kane scores twice to cancel out Gylfi Sigurdsson's two goals
item.description: Harry Kane scores twice to earn a point for Tottenham against fellow top-four chasers Everton at Goodison Park.

item.title: Covid-19: Pandemic funeral services not what people 'deserve'
item.description: Gary Stewart's wife Jude died in January, but the pandemic meant restrictions on the funeral service.

item.title: Leonardo da Vinci: Aidan Turner glad artist's sexuality reflected in series
item.description: Poldark actor Aidan Turner is playing Leonardo da Vinci in a new historical drama.

item.title: Breonna Taylor: Publisher refuses to distribute police officer's book
item.description: Publisher Simon & Schuster says it won't distribute the work following a backlash online.

item.title: Joshua White murder: Three men guilty over Hackney stabbing
item.description: A six-year-old girl on roller-skates was knocked flying during the deadly attack on Joshua White.

item.title: Rachid Khadla: Father made daughter sign 'never get fat' contract
item.description: Rachid Khadla is jailed for cruelty to his three children, who he bullied and assaulted for years.

item.title: The Papers: 'Queen bids farewell', and Helen McCrory tributes
item.description: Saturday's front pages are dominated by details of the Duke of Edinburgh's funeral

item.title: In pictures: Helen McCrory's acting career
item.description: A look back at the characters portrayed by the British actress, who has died aged 52.

item.title: Covid: Art and challenges keep Para athlete on track
item.description: Tom Wilson, who has cerebral palsy and is profoundly deaf, has not let the pandemic hold him back.

item.title: Land Rover hearse designed by Prince Philip unveiled
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh oversaw modifications to the car, which will carry his coffin at Saturday's funeral.

item.title: Raúl Castro's political life in pictures
item.description: Raúl Castro has stepped down as first secretary of Cuba's Communist Party ending a 60-year career.

item.title: Reward doubled to find 'world's longest rabbit' stolen from garden
item.description: Concerns are growing for 12-year-old Darius who vanished from his Worcestershire home on Saturday.

item.title: Agatha Christie: Wallingford home on sale for £2.75m
item.description: The author lived at Winterbrook House in Oxfordshire from 1934 until her death in 1976.

item.title: Escaping the anti-vax conspiracy rabbit hole
item.description: Catherine was a big believer in anti-vaccine conspiracy theories, but has since stopped believing in them.

item.title: Titanic: Searching for the 'missing' Chinese survivors
item.description: When the Titanic sank, six Chinese men were rescued - but their ordeal didn't end there.

item.title: Chile sees Covid surge despite vaccination success
item.description: The country's vaccination rollout is one of the fastest in the world, so why are Covid cases surging?

item.title: How sex surrogates are helping injured Israeli soldiers
item.description: Therapy with surrogate sexual partners is used in Israel to rehabilitate badly injured soldiers.

item.title: Health anxiety: The fear of illness making people quit jobs and move home
item.description: For some people, Covid has fuelled a debilitating mental health condition known as health anxiety.

item.title: Concrete to cobbles: Can a city centre go back in time?
item.description: Does a half-demolished eyesore shopping centre give a city a unique opportunity to turn back time?

item.title: India coronavirus: Desperate Covid-19 patients turn to black market for drugs
item.description: Amid a punishing second wave, people across India are finding drugs, oxygen and beds in short supply.

item.title: Watson & Boulter put GB in control - report & highlights
item.description: Heather Watson and Katie Boulter put Great Britain 2-0 ahead in their Billie Jean King Cup play-off against Mexico.

item.title: Mourinho 'couldn't care less' about Pogba's criticism
item.description: Tottenham boss Jose Mourinho says he "couldn't care less" about Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba's criticism of his management.

item.title: Evans reaches semi-final in Monte Carlo - report & highlights
item.description: British number one Dan Evans comes from a set down to beat David Goffin and reach the semi-finals of the Monte Carlo Masters.

item.title: O'Sullivan wants 'protection' from 'over-excited' fans at Crucible
item.description: Defending champion Ronnie O'Sullivan says he wants "protection" from fans at the World Snooker Championship.

item.title: NBA: Miles Bridges' 'filthy' dunk leads plays of the week
item.description: Watch the NBA plays of the week, featuring a "filthy" dunk from Miles Bridges of the Charlotte Hornets.

item.title: Hull KR score record-breaking try after seven seconds in Huddersfield win
item.description: Ben Crooks scores the fastest try in Super League history as Hull KR edge out Huddersfield for their first win of the season.

item.title: Who is going to Prince Philip's funeral?
item.description: Covid restrictions mean only 30 mourners will be allowed to attend the funeral of the duke.

item.title: Prince Philip funeral: Plans, timings and TV coverage
item.description: What time is the funeral for the Duke of Edinburgh and what will happen?

item.title: Prince Philip: How deaths of public figures can affect others
item.description: Many were saddened by the death of the duke but why do people grieve over those they have never met?

item.title: Prince Philip: How can Prince Harry attend the funeral?
item.description: The Duke of Sussex has returned to the UK for the first time since "stepping back" from royal duties.

item.title: Why was Prince Philip born on this dining table?
item.description: A lesser known fact about the Duke of Edinburgh is he was born on a dining table in Corfu. But why?

item.title: Prince Philip: Military takes part in rehearsals for funeral
item.description: Prince Philip will be remembered in a service at St George's Chapel, at Windsor Castle, on Saturday.

item.title: Obituary: HRH The Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh
item.description: Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, won widespread respect for his steadfast and constant support of the Queen.

item.title: Prince Philip: A simple, family farewell
item.description: A no-nonsense moderniser, the duke's last service to the monarchy may be in the way he departs it, reports the BBC's Jonny Dymond.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Pub gardens and non-essential shops can now open in England - as part of the next stage of easing lockdown rules.

item.title: Covid: What's happening with universities as lockdown eases?
item.description: Face-to-face courses cannot resume on campuses in England until at least 17 May.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: A traffic light system ranking foreign countries by coronavirus risk is to be introduced - the rules on UK holidays are also easing.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England is being encouraged to take two rapid coronavirus tests a week.

item.title: Covid: How does the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine work?
item.description: People under 30 are being offered an alternative to the AstraZeneca vaccine after a review into rare blood clots.

item.title: Why are so many babies dying of Covid-19 in Brazil?
item.description: As the pandemic rages in Brazil, hundreds of babies and young children are dying of Covid.

item.title: Prince Philip: A turbulent childhood stalked by exile, mental illness and death
item.description: In marrying, Philip was able to regain the "simple pleasures" of family life he had lost aged eight.

item.title: Race report: Was controversy part of the plan?
item.description: How the government handled the release of a contentious report on racial disparity in the UK.

item.title: 'We found a baby on the subway - now he's our son'
item.description: Danny Stewart saw something on the floor of an NY subway station - soon he would treasure it more than anything.
